intro: Sempervivum himalayense, commonly known as the Himalayan houseleek, is a succulent plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features rosettes of fleshy, thick leaves that are typically green or bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, thriving in full sun and well-draining soil. Sempervivum himalayense is a hardy, low-maintenance plant often cultivated as a decorative succulent in gardens and containers.
